summary:
A car bomb assassinated Russian Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov outside his Moscow apartment today, marking the highest-profile strike inside Russia since the Ukraine war began. The attack, amid an ongoing investigation, underscores Kyiv's deepening reach into enemy territory even as Russian forces press advantages on the ground. Hours later, Moscow retaliated with its largest aerial assault in months: 650 drones and 36 missiles across 13 Ukrainian regions, killing three people including a four-year-old child and knocking out power for millions amid freezing winter temperatures. President Zelenskyy cited recent peace talk progress, but the barrage dims those prospects and heightens civilian risks ahead of Christmas.

This escalation coincides with NATO's first coordinated response to suspected sabotage of Baltic Sea cables, including a fresh severing that threatens vital undersea communications and energy links. Alliance navies are now patrolling to shield infrastructure from hybrid threats widely attributed to Russia, signaling a broader hardening of Western defenses. Meanwhile, in eastern Congo, Rwanda-backed M23 rebels overran government troops to enter Goma, sparking gunfire and shelling that has displaced over one million people and strained the U.N.'s main aid hub, risking a humanitarian collapse in a conflict killing thousands yearly.

Looking ahead, Israel permitted thousands of displaced Palestinians to return on foot to northern Gaza after crossing a military zone, following a hostage-release deal. The move eases suffering for over two million residents but occurs as fighting persists elsewhere, hinting at fragile steps toward de-escalation amid the 15-month war.

headlines.title: NATO Mounts First Coordinated Response to Suspected Baltic Sea Cable Sabotage
headlines.summary: NATO launches its first coordinated response after another deep-sea cable severs in the Baltic Sea amid suspected sabotage of critical infrastructure. Alliance members protect undersea networks vital for communications and energy. This escalates Western defenses against hybrid threats from Russia.

headlines.title: Trump's DOJ Transfers 10 Spared Death Row Inmates to Supermax Prison
headlines.summary: Trump administration officials move 10 of 37 men whose executions Biden halted to ADX Florence, the 'Alcatraz of the Rockies.' One inmate attempts suicide while awaiting transfer. This reverses Biden's commutations, signaling renewed federal death penalty push affecting prisoners and justice policy.

headlines.title: Russia Fires 650 Drones and 36 Missiles at Ukraine Killing Three People
headlines.summary: Russia launches over 650 drones and three dozen missiles across 13 Ukrainian regions, killing three including a 4-year-old child and causing power outages in cold weather. Zelensky notes peace progress, but attacks persist. This undermines talks and endangers civilians ahead of Christmas.

headlines.title: US Justice Department Releases Thousands of Epstein-Linked Documents
headlines.summary: Justice Department publishes thousands of new Jeffrey Epstein files, including jail surveillance footage from the month of his death. Documents detail the sex offender's network. Public access aids investigations and accountability for associates, impacting legal proceedings and public trust.

headlines.title: Car Bomb Kills Russian Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov in Moscow
headlines.summary: A car bomb assassinates Russian Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov in Moscow. The attack targets high-ranking military amid Ukraine war. Investigation underway; this escalates internal security threats and potential retaliation, affecting Russia's command structure.

headlines.title: SpaceX Launches Crew-10 to Retrieve NASA Astronauts Stuck on ISS
headlines.summary: SpaceX Falcon 9 carries NASA astronauts Anne McClain and Nichole Ayers, Japan's Takuya Onishi, and Russia's Kirill Peskov from Kennedy Space Center to the ISS. Crew enables return of Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams after nine months. Routine rotations resume normal operations.

headlines.title: Israel Allows Palestinians to Return to Northern Gaza After Hostage Deal
headlines.summary: Israel permits displaced Gazans to cross a military zone into northern Gaza following a hostage release breakthrough. Thousands return on foot. This eases humanitarian crisis for over 2 million residents, though fighting continues in other areas.

headlines.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Goma Displacing Over One Million People
headlines.summary: M23 rebels overrun Congolese troops and enter Goma, triggering gunfire and shelling. Over one million displaced shelter in the aid hub city. U.N. warns of humanitarian collapse; this intensifies eastern Congo conflict, straining regional stability and aid efforts.
